author: pdobacz
content: <@727296082484265073> Hi, I think it was you who on recent ACDE posted a message about not being in favour of ISCONTRACT opcode [proposed in EIP-7761](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8838), from a general AA standpoint. We're trying to gather arguments in the discussion about having it (and when). Would you have a moment to expand on this argument (we can then put it into the EIP's Rationale), please?

author: chfast
content: So from the comments from the implementation of 7702, it looks it adds a new EVM execution mode (next to "normal" and "static") where some instructions behave differently as in other modes. Is this expected in the implementation?

author: lightclient
content: it doesn't really create a new mode, it completely modifies all code accessing ops in all situations

author: gumb00
content:
The new mode is like "execute the code of account A in the context of account B; if A is a precompile execute empty code"

It's very similar to the mode in which DELEGATECALL executes, except the precompile part is different

author: gumb00
content: But I think it's a bit of EVMC API perspective specifics, other implementations might not see it like this

author: chfast
content: This kinda makes it different from `DELEGATECALL`. Does it make sense?

author: gumb00
content: at least for evmone it definitely would be fewer special cases, if precompiles were executed

author: lightclient
content: i don't have much of a preference. if it is creating complexity we can just execute the precompiles
